0.title: Jahangirpuri violence a criminal conspiracy: Police in report to MHA
0.article_body: The Delhi Police on Tuesday submitted the preliminary report to Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) into the Jahangirpuri violence that took place during a Hanuman Jayanti rally on Saturday. Police said the violence was a part of criminal conspiracy. In the report, the police mentioned immediate steps taken by the forces to control the situation.

1.title: Since April 15, life has been about baby crying, no sleep: Mohena on son's birth
1.article_body: 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' actress Mohena Kumari took to Instagram to share post after the birth of her son on April 15. "These last few days have gone by so fast...Since the 15th of April...life has been all about...hospital bed, baby nurses...baby feeding, baby crying...baby pacifying, no sleep, medicines and of course recovery," she wrote.

2.title: I ran away from home to pursue acting: 'Arjun Reddy' actress Shalini
2.article_body: Actress Shalini Pandey, who made her acting debut with Telugu film 'Arjun Reddy' said she ran away from home to pursue acting. "Dad wasn't convinced to let me [become an actress]. I was trying to convince him for four years but he wasn't letting me pursue it," added Shalini. Shalini will be seen in the upcoming Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'.

3.title: Leaked pictures of Prabhas from 'Salaar' sets surface online
3.article_body: Two pictures of actor Prabhas from the sets of his upcoming film 'Salaar' have been leaked online. The film is directed and written by Prashanth Neel, who has directed the 'KGF' franchise. Actress Shruti Haasan is the female lead in the film and actor Prithviraj will also feature in the film. The film's release date is yet to be announced.

4.title: Growing stronger: Tahira shares a video lifting heavy weights after 3.5 yrs
4.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana's wife, author Tahira Kashyap Khurrana shared a glimpse of her workout video. Her latest video shows her regaining her strength and lifting heavy weights after three and a half years. Sharing the video, Tahira wrote, "Growing stronger! Being able to lift this much after 3.5 years." Taking to the comments section, actress Shilpa Shetty commented, "Daaanggg."

5.title: SRK to work with Rajkumar Hirani for first time, announces film 'Dunki'
5.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter to announce his new film 'Dunki' with filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani. "Dear @RajkumarHirani sir, you turned out to be my Santa Claus...you start [film], I'll reach on time...actually I will start living on the set...Feeling humbled & excited to finally work with you...Bringing to you all #Dunki...in cinemas on 22nd December 2023," he wrote.

6.title: Hijab won't be allowed during K'taka II PUC exams: Education Minister
6.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said that hijabs won't be allowed during the II Pre-University Course Examination. "All students must follow rules on uniform, hijab cladding students won't be allowed," he said. The row over hijab began in December 2021, when six female students of Government PU College for Girls in Udupi were not allowed to attend classes wearing headscarves.

7.title: Karthik can be used as a finisher in the upcoming T20 WC: Gavaskar
7.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that RCB batter Dinesh Karthik can play the finisher's role for India in this year's T20 World Cup. "He's (Karthik) just changing the complexion of the game with his performance. He's doing the job that you can expect him to do at number 6 or 7 at the (T20) World Cup," Gavaskar said.

8.title: 'Feeling good,' says McCoy after bowling a match-winning final over vs KKR
8.article_body: Rajasthan Royals pacer Obed McCoy said that he "felt good" after the match against KKR in which the West Indian defended 11 runs in the final over and led RR to a victory. "This is my first game since last year...had come under pressure, feeling good, it was just about getting over the nerves and going hard," McCoy said.

9.title: Philippines envoy to China dies aged 74 while in quarantine
9.article_body: The Philippines' Ambassador to China, Jose Santiago "Chito" Sta. Romana, has died aged 74 while he was reportedly in 21-day quarantine in Huangshan city after returning from the Philippines. The Philippine Foreign Affairs Department condoled his death and said the Philippines and China's ties "flourished despite differences" under Sta. Romana's tenure. He was appointed as envoy to China in 2016.

10.title: Auto, taxi drivers call off strike demanding hike in fares in Delhi
10.article_body: Unions representing autorickshaws and taxis have called off strike demanding a hike in fares in Delhi. "If no action is taken in 25 days, then after 25 days we will shut Delhi's total food chain including tempos and trucks," an official said. Autorickshaw and taxi drivers have been demanding a cut in CNG prices and a hike in fares.

11.title: Arjun, Bhumi begin shooting for 'The Ladykiller' in Himachal Pradesh
11.article_body: Arjun Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar have started shooting for filmmaker Ajay Bahl's next movie, 'The Ladykiller', in Himachal Pradesh. Arjun, while speaking about the forthcoming project, said, "The Ladykiller is one of the most exciting scripts of my career." "I'm thrilled to be collaborating with Bhumi and my director Ajay Bahl for the first time," he added.

12.title: Chiranjeevi reaches for the last rites of producer Narayan Das Narang in Hyderabad
12.article_body: Chiranjeevi reached for the funeral of producer Narayan Das Narang. The actor will pay his respects at the last rites which will reportedly begin in the afternoon. Several celebrities from Tollywood will attend the funeral in Hyderabad. Chiranjeevi also paid tribute to the late producer on Twitter and said he created a niche for himself with his expertise.

13.title: Trying to convince EU to restrict Russian oil supplies: France
13.article_body: France has said that it is trying to convince the members of the European Union (EU) to restrict oil supplies from Russia in view of the Ukraine war. "In light of what is happening now in Donbas, the stoppage of oil supplies from Russia is necessary more than ever," said French minister Bruno Le Maire.

14.title: I said, 'If I perform, everything will fall into place': Suryakumar on IPL 2020 match vs RCB
14.article_body: Recalling his unbeaten 79-run innings against RCB in IPL 2020, MI batter Suryakumar Yadav said he was disappointed prior to the match as he wasn't picked in India squad. "When I went in to bat, the target was in front of me. I said to myself, 'If I perform here, everything else will fall into place'," he added.

15.title: Gang of car thieves busted in Ferozepur, 2 members arrested
15.article_body: A gang of car thieves was busted in Ferozepur with the arrest of two of its members and the recovery of two stolen cars and a firearm. "Following a tip-off, the police team intercepted the accused in a car and recovered a .32-bore weapon along with two of its magazines and 10 cartridges," Ferozepur SSP, Charanjit Singh, said.

16.title: HFDC no longer among India's top 10 most valuable companies
16.article_body: India's largest housing finance company HDFC Ltd is no longer among the top 10 most valuable companies of India in terms of market capitalisation. The shares of HDFC have plunged nearly 19% after the announcement of its merger with HDFC Bank earlier this month. Meanwhile, HDFC Bank is the third most valuable company of India after Reliance Industries and TCS.

17.title: Lost teeth on stage, it's going to be lifetime memory for me: Hunarbaaz winner
17.article_body: Akash Singh, who won the reality show 'Hunarbaaz: Desh Ki Shaan' on Sunday, has revealed that he fell off a pole and broke three teeth while preparing for his act on stage. "It's going to be...lifetime memory for me that I lost my teeth on...'Hunarbaaz' stage," Akash said, adding, "All my...hard work bore fruits and I could win the trophy."

18.title: From the first draft, I knew I wanted Taapsee to do my film: Sudhir Mishra
18.article_body: Discussing his upcoming short film in an untitled anthology produced by filmmaker Anubhav Sinha and Bhushan Kumar, director Sudhir Mishra said, "From the first draft, I knew I wanted Taapsee Pannu to do the film." Taapsee stated that she had a "ball of a time", creating memories of a "lifetime". The anthology is based on stories around the COVID-19 pandemic.

19.title: Over 2,500 differently-abled cricketers register to play for India
19.article_body: The Differently-Abled Cricket Council of India (DCCI) has registered over 2,500 differently-abled cricketers in its registration process drive that started nearly a week ago. The drive is initiated to streamline the process and "bring a system in place" in differently-abled cricket. "All the data collected will be shared with the BCCI which will further be...sent to state associations," DCCI said.

20.title: Russia, Vietnam plan joint military drills
20.article_body: Russia's Eastern Military District has said that the country will hold joint military drills with Vietnam. A meeting was held between the representatives of both countries in this regard. "In the course of the talks, the two parties agreed on the agenda for the upcoming military drills, specifying deadlines and a venue for holding the drills," said Eastern Military District.

21.title: Easy tiger, why do you always fight: Rahul jokingly tells Krishna over fight with Finch
21.article_body: RR fast bowler Prasidh Krishna took to Instagram to share pictures from their match against KKR, which they won by seven runs. Referring to KKR opener Aaron Finch and Krishna's verbal fight in the match, KL Rahul jokingly commented, "Easy tiger. Yakk jagla adtya yavaglu? (Why do you always fight?)"

22.title: Ola CEO dances to 'Bijlee Bijlee' while testing e-scooter's music feature
22.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal took to social media to share a video of him dancing to 'Bijlee Bijlee' song while testing a feature to play music on Ola's electric scooters. "Doing some final 'expert testing' for the MoveOS 2 music feature," he tweeted. Earlier, he had said that MoveOS 2.0 operating system for scooters will roll out by April end.

23.title: She's amazing: Tiger on getting defeated by 7-yr-old girl in backflip challenge
23.article_body: Tiger Shroff appeared on 'Dance India Dance L'il Masters' to promote his film 'Heropanti 2'. On the show, a seven-year-old contestant, Sanvi Negi, asked Tiger to do a backflip battle with her, however, he was defeated by Sanvi. Reacting to it, Tiger said, "I did try competing with her, but I had no choice but to accept my defeat. She's...amazing."

24.title: Bhumi wins awards for COVID Warrior, 'Badhaai Do' at Asia One Awards
24.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has been honoured with the COVID-19 commitment Award and the Black Swan Path-Breaking actor award for 'Badhaai Do' at the Asia One Awards. The actress shared a picture of holding the awards on Instagram, writing, "Thank you for the honour #AsiaOneAwards and the distinguished jury that acknowledged our work...This one is dedicated to every covid warrior."

25.title: I work best under pressure but won't worry myself into mess: Arjun Bijlani
25.article_body: Actor Arjun Bijlani said he works best under pressure, but won't have sleepless nights or fret and worry himself into a "mess" for it. "I have never been someone to get bogged down by pressure and numbers," added Arjun. "I have been in the industry [long] enough to not want to take up the same run-of-the-mill roles," stated Arjun.

26.title: GB Nagar reports 107 new COVID cases; 33 children among those infected
26.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar reported 107 new cases of COVID-19 and zero deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the health bulletin issued on Tuesday. Of the 107 cases, 33 are school students who have tested positive for the virus, PTI quoted Chief Medical Officer Sunil Kumar Sharma as saying. Now, the active COVID-19 cases in the district reached 411.

27.title: Russia's new offensive will fail, they don't have enough strength: Ukraine
27.article_body: Russia's new offensive in eastern Ukraine is going "very cautiously" but "the battle will not go in Russia's favour", Ukrainian Presidential Advisor Oleksiy Arestovych said. "Their offensive will fail, I give you a 99% guarantee, they simply do not have enough strength," he added. Arestovych also said that Russian forces were trying to find "sensitive spots" in Ukraine's defences.

28.title: Flipkart acquires D2C SaaS platform ANS Commerce
28.article_body: Flipkart has acquired D2C SaaS platform ANS Commerce for an undisclosed amount. The deal is expected to close in the second half of 2022, subject to customary closing conditions. ANS Commerce will continue to operate as an independent business. ANS provides various services to companies and brands looking to sell online, including services that help brands set up digital storefronts.

29.title: Dalits stage protest in Rajasthan over attack on rally on Ambedkar Jayanti
29.article_body: Several Dalits gathered on the streets at Rajasthan's Bharatpur on Tuesday to protest against an alleged attack on a rally that took place on April 14 to mark Ambedkar Jayanti. They alleged that members of Gujjar community attacked them with sticks injuring nine people. Later, a false case of theft was also filed against over two dozen Dalits, they claimed.

30.title: China signs security pact with Solomon Islands amid US' concerns
30.article_body: China said on Tuesday that it has signed a security pact with the Solomon Islands. The pact entails China's assistance in maintaining social order and national security in the Solomon Islands, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin said. The announcement comes amid concerns by US, Australia and New Zealand about a potential increase in China's military presence in Indo-Pacific region.

31.title: RR debutant McCoy celebrates his first-ever IPL wicket with 'Pushpa' move, video viral
31.article_body: RR debutant Obed McCoy celebrated his first-ever wicket in IPL by doing the 'Pushpa' move. McCoy dismissed KKR wicketkeeper-batter Sheldon Jackson in the last over to bag his maiden wicket in IPL. McCoy went on to pick another wicket in the same over as RR defeated KKR by seven runs. The 25-year-old West Indian registered figures of 3.4-0-41-2.

32.title: Priyanka's co-star Sam shares 'It's All Coming Back to Me' still, deletes later
32.article_body: Actor Sam Heughan shared a still with actress Priyanka Chopra from their upcoming film 'It's All Coming Back to Me' on Instagram. He later deleted the post but the picture has gone viral on social media. Priyanka plays a woman dealing with her fiancé's death and sends messages to his old number which is now owned by Sam's character.

33.title: Akhilesh extends support to Dalit boy who was made to lick feet in UP
33.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav extended support to the Dalit boy who was assaulted and made to lick the feet of an accused as seen in a viral video and promised him admission in Kendriya Vidyalaya. Yadav also ensured safety of his entire family. SP blamed BJP for this incident and said that caste discrimination is "a gift given by BJP".

34.title: 5 held in Himachal after WhatsApp chat indicates paper leak in police exam
34.article_body: Five youngsters from Solan's Arki area were arrested a week after their WhatsApp chat was shared on social media, allegedly indicating that the paper of the Himachal Pradesh Police constable recruitment exam had been leaked. All five had scored marks above 60 out of 80. "Their cell phones have been seized and are being analysed," Solan SP, Virender Sharma, said.

35.title: Suspected drug peddler injured in police firing in Assam
35.article_body: A suspected drug peddler was injured in police firing in Karbi Anglong district of Assam, police said. The accused reportedly tried to escape while being taken to apprehend his associate from Dimapur, police added. "When he refused to stop to our warnings, we had to fire at him and he was injured in...leg," a police officer said.

36.title: World's tallest woman now holds 3 more Guinness records, pics surface
36.article_body: Guinness World Records has announced that Rumeysa Gelgi, considered the world's tallest woman, now holds three more world records. Gelgi, who's 7 feet and 0.7 inches tall, now holds the record for the longest finger (female). Additionally, she holds the record for 'largest hands on a living person (female)'. Gelgi also has the longest back (female), measuring 59.9 cm.

37.title: Economics graduate sets up tea stall after not getting job in Bihar
37.article_body: An Economics graduate, Priyanka Gupta, has been running a tea stall near Women's College in Bihar's Patna after not getting a job in the last two years. The 24-year-old, who is from Purnea district, said she was inspired to run a tea stall from Prafull Billore, who runs a tea shop in Ahmedabad despite having an MBA degree.

38.title: Buttler has 2 tons in IPL 2022, you can expect the same from Rahul: Aakash
38.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said that LSG captain KL Rahul, who slammed a century in their last game against MI, will score another hundred in the ongoing IPL season. "Rahul is in exceptional form. He will not be satisfied with one hundred. Jos Buttler has hit two tons, you can expect the same from Rahul as well," Aakash stated.

39.title: Biden has no plans to visit Ukrainian capital Kyiv: White House
39.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Monday reiterated that there are no plans for US President Joe Biden to visit the Ukrainian capital Kyiv. The comment comes after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy invited Biden to visit the city. Several European Union leaders have visited the city in recent weeks as a show of support for Ukraine.

40.title: Maha Police begin action against those with cases of communal dispute
40.article_body: The Maharashtra Police have announced a list of steps they said they would take in order to maintain communal harmony amid the ongoing azaan row and the use of loudspeakers in mosques in the state. "Maharashtra Police started taking preventive action against those having cases regarding communal disputes and IPC section 153(A) and 295(A), against them," police said.

41.title: NEET aspirant in Bhopal kills sister-in-law as her son's cries disturbed his studies
41.article_body: A 22-year-old man allegedly stabbed his 25-year-old sister-in-law to death, angry that the constant cries of her two-year-old son disturbed him as he prepared for the medical entrance exam NEET in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said. The accused took a knife from the kitchen and stabbed her brutally and killed her on the spot, police added. The accused was arrested.

42.title: Viral pic shows man sleeping on luggage rack of Mumbai local train
42.article_body: A picture of a man sleeping on a luggage rack of a Mumbai local train is going viral on social media. The man in a pair of jeans and t-shirt could be seen sleeping with his eyes covered with a cloth. The picture initially surfaced on Reddit with a caption, "A little jealous ngl."

43.title: He wanted the world to attend his wedding; we had no place to sit: Millind's sister
43.article_body: After 'Bigg Boss OTT' contestant Millind Gaba tied the knot with his long-time girlfriend, Pria Beniwal, in a grand ceremony, his sister Pallavi Gaba shared that it was his dream that the world should attend his wedding. "It was a big fat Indian wedding. We were all wondering where we should even sit, as all...sofas were occupied," she added.

44.title: Huma Qureshi shares her look from chef Tarla Dalal's biopic
44.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi took to Instagram on Tuesday to share her look from a film based on the life of India's first-ever home chef Tarla Dalal. The actress will play the lead role in the upcoming biopic, titled 'Tarla'. Produced by Ronnie Screwvala, Ashwiny Iyer Tiwari, and Nitesh Tiwari, 'Tarla' will be directed by Piyush Gupta.

45.title: 'Pol Khol' campaign vehicle vandalised in Mumbai; BJP blames Shiv Sena
45.article_body: BJP's 'Pol Khol' campaign vehicle, one of the 40 screen-mounted vans, was found vandalised in Mumbai's Chembur on Tuesday morning, the party said. BJP leader Pravin Darekar said that Shiv Sena was behind the attack and asked the police to arrest the "hooligans" involved without delay. BJP uses the vehicle to campaign against Shiv Sena ahead of Mumbai civic elections.

46.title: Security situation in J&K is far better than before: DGP
46.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir DGP Dilbag Singh said that the security situation in the Union Territory is "far better than before". "The security situation is far better...and counter-insurgency operations are being carried out successfully on a daily basis," the DGP said. "There is no doubt that terror elements are doing their actions but those involved...(are) neutralised soon," he added.

47.title: PPCB to penalise Ludhiana civic body for 'failing' to manage solid waste
47.article_body: The Punjab Pollution Control Board (PPCB) on Monday said it will penalise the Ludhiana civic body for its "failure" to manage the city’s solid waste. This comes after fire incidents were reported at the municipal corporation’s primary dumping ground on Tajpur Road for four consecutive days. The PPCB officials observed that the issue was resulting in air and water pollution.

48.title: Seemed wasteful: Musk on Tesla removing mobile connectors with cars
48.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk defended the firm's decision to stop including its mobile connector with new car purchases, saying, "Usage statistics were super low, so seemed wasteful." Tesla will instead sell its charging kit separately for a lower $200 price. Musk added Tesla will "make it easy" to order the mobile connector when purchasing a car.

49.title: Exercise restraint in reporting communal tensions: EGI to media houses
49.article_body: The Editors Guild of India (EGI) on Tuesday urged media houses to exercise restraint while reporting incidents of communal disturbances in different parts of the country. The Guild said that while the desire to be first with the news is understandable, many editors and reporters are reportedly rushing to conclusions without a full appreciation of the facts and context.

50.title: Jaipur woman gets buried under snow in avalanche-prone Himachal area, dies
50.article_body: A 24-year-old tourist from Jaipur, who slipped in an avalanche-prone area and got buried under snow in Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul and Spiti district, died during treatment at a hospital. The woman was roaming near Koksar waterfall when the snow she was walking on suddenly caved in. The district Deputy Commissioner has urged people not to venture near avalanche-prone areas.

51.title: Millionaire asks military to bomb his mansion after Russian forces occupy it in Ukraine
51.article_body: A Ukrainian millionaire asked the country's military to bomb his mansion after he saw it had been seized and occupied by Russian forces. Andrey Stavnitser, the CEO of the Ukrainian IT company TransInvestService, said he saw Russian forces move into his property via a security camera. Stavnitser left Ukraine for Poland after Russia invaded.

52.title: Preity thanks Hrithik for helping out with twins Jai, Gia on flight; shares pic
52.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta took to Instagram to share her picture with actor Hrithik Roshan and thanked him for helping out with her twins Jai and Gia on a long flight. "Thank you so much @hrithikroshan for going out of your way & helping out...Now I see why you are such an amazing & thoughtful father. I love you," she wrote.

53.title: Alia resumes work post-wedding with Ranbir Kapoor; pics surface
53.article_body: Alia Bhatt has resumed work after tying the knot with actor Ranbir Kapoor. The actress was spotted at the Mumbai airport. Reportedly, Alia will be flying to Jaisalmer to complete the shoot for Dharma Productions' film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. Pictures have surfaced online, where Alia is seen donning a pink kurta along with a matching dupatta.

54.title: Wasn't expecting Umesh Yadav to smash Boult for 19 runs: Buttler
54.article_body: RR's Jos Buttler said he wasn't expecting KKR pacer Umesh Yadav to smash Trent Boult around in the 18th over of their match on Monday. Umesh came in when KKR needed 38 runs to win in the final three overs and smashed two sixes and a four as KKR scored 20 runs in that over. KKR lost by seven runs.

55.title: Fire breaks out at a shop in Delhi's Kirti Nagar, 15 fire tenders on spot
55.article_body: A fire broke out at one of the shops in West Delhi's Kirti Nagar furniture market on Tuesday, ANI reported citing Delhi Fire Service (DFS) officials. A call about the fire was received around 1:16 pm and firefighting operations are underway. ''We have rushed 15 fire tenders to the spot,'' said DFS Director Atul Garg.

56.title: No chance of communal clashes post-Ramzan in Maharashtra: Minister
56.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Tuesday said there is no possibility of communal clashes erupting in the state after the ongoing month of Ramzan. "Some parties are attempting to create a communal divide in the state...There is no information on such (riots) in the state. However, the police are monitoring the situation closely," Patil said.

57.title: UP government cancels leaves of police personnel till May 4
57.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government has cancelled leaves of all police personnel in the state till May 4. The orders, issued late on Monday night, have reportedly been passed in view of festivals in the coming days. CM Yogi Adityanath has also directed officials to hold dialogues with religious leaders within the next 24 hours to ensure peace during the upcoming festivals.

58.title: 27-yr-old woman stabbed in thigh on New York City subway; suspect at large
58.article_body: A 27-year-old woman was stabbed in the thigh on a New York City subway platform on Monday, police said. The unidentified suspect fled "topside" out of the subway system and has not been arrested yet. The attack comes six days after a 62-year-old man opened fire in a New York City subway car, injuring more than 20 people.

59.title: Ukraine shoots down $15 mn Russian helicopter with $100 missile system
59.article_body: Ukrainian troops shot down a $15 million Russian Ka-52 helicopter by using an air defence missile system worth $100. As per a post shared by the Ukrainian military unit Operational Command 'East', the military unit used an 'Igla', a portable surface-to-air missile (SAM) system that was developed by the Soviet Union. They also shared pictures of the crash site.

60.title: Jason Momoa to star in Warner Bros' 'Minecraft' film: Reports
60.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa is all set to star in Warner Bros' live-action 'Minecraft' movie, according to reports. The upcoming film will reportedly be directed by Jared Hess of 'Napoleon Dynamite' fame. Jason will also be seen in 'Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom', the sequel to the 2018 film 'Aquaman'. The sequel is slated to release in March 2023.

61.title: NCP leader demands arrest of Raj Thackeray over loudspeaker row
61.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Shaikh Asif said he has written to Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse demanding the arrest of MNS Chief Raj Thackeray over the ongoing loudspeaker row in the state. Thackeray on Sunday had asked to take down loudspeakers outside the mosques saying, "Muslims should understand that religion is not above law and country."

62.title: 'Sanaa' changed me as person & actor: Radhika after wrapping shoot
62.article_body: After wrapping the shoot for her upcoming film 'Sanaa', Radhika Madan said that the film changed her as a person and as an actor. "Sanaa is...the toughest character to let go off. She slowly seeps into your veins and before you know it she has already captured you," Radhika added. "Sanaa will always be closest to my heart," she stated.

63.title: BBMP offers 5% rebate on property tax if people pay it before Apr 30
63.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta has announced that people can get a 5% rebate if they pay their property tax for the 2022-23 financial year before April 30. According to BBMP, property owners would've to pay the full amount in one instalment in order to avail the rebate. The amount can be paid using BBMP's website.

64.title: 4 firearms seized in West Bengal's Malda, Bihar man arrested
64.article_body: Police arrested a resident of Bihar's Munger and seized four firearms from his possession in West Bengal's Malda district. The accused was nabbed at Khaltipur Railway Station on Monday while he was travelling aboard the Katihar-Howrah Express, an official said. He was scheduled to deliver the guns to a person in Kaliachak in the Malda district, the official added.

65.title: 5 labourers from Bengal suffocate to death at K'taka fish processing unit
65.article_body: Five labourers from West Bengal suffocated to death at a fish processing unit in Karnataka's Mangaluru. The incident took place when one of them went inside a 20-foot-deep waste water tank to clean it and got stuck. After he screamed for help, other labourers rushed to help him, but failed. Three of the labourers have been hospitalised for further treatment.

66.title: Shah Rukh's film with Atlee to be made on a budget of ₹200 cr: Report
66.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film with filmmaker Atlee will reportedly be made on a budget of ₹200 crore. "[It will be] the costliest film for Shah Rukh Khan till date after the soon-to-be-released 'Pathaan', which is made on a budget of ₹250 crore," the report stated. Shah Rukh's yet-untitled film with Atlee will reportedly also feature Nayanthara and Sanya Malhotra.

67.title: 'Jayeshbhai...' will change definition of heroism on-screen: Ranveer
67.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said that his upcoming film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' will change the definition of heroism on-screen. "Hopefully, [it will] leave an important message to people in the most entertaining and hilarious fashion," he stated. Speaking about his character in the film, Ranveer said, "He is quick-witted and he has his heart in the right place."

68.title: Neither Cong nor NCP, Shiv Sena will dump each other: Cong Minister
68.article_body: Maharashtra Minister of State for Home Satej Patil has said that "neither the NCP nor the Shiv Sena will dump the Congress, nor will Congress" dump them. Patil has also revealed that the state Congress unit has invited senior leader Rahul Gandhi to visit Mumbai. "He (Rahul) is expected in the second week of May," the Congress leader said.

69.title: PMPML marks 'Bus Day' with low fares, high bus frequency
69.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) marked 'Bus Day' on Monday with as many as 1800 buses plying on roads and discounted ticket fares for commuters. Dedicated lanes for PMPML buses plying on certain routes were also set up in an effort to avoid traffic congestion. Additionally, female commuters availed free rides within Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad limits.

70.title: B'luru man threatens to expose female friend's HIV +ve status, extorts money
70.article_body: Karnataka Police have filed an FIR against a man who allegedly threatened to expose the HIV positive status of his female friend and also extorted money from her. Reports said accused also extorted gold chain worth ₹2.8 lakh. He told the woman's relatives about her being HIV positive. When questioned, he beat her up and threatened to rape her daughter.

71.title: Odisha hikes daily dietary expenses of prisoners from ₹64 to ₹80
71.article_body: The dietary expense of prisoners in Odisha has been increased from ₹64 to ₹80 per day, the state government said in an official statement on Monday. While the government has also approved the inclusion of Jail Hospitals under the Niramaya Scheme, the user credentials have been generated for 32 Jail Headquarter Hospitals in E-Niramaya Software.

72.title: 1 kg of hand-rolled Japanese tea leaves sells for nearly ₹12 lakh
72.article_body: One kilogram of new hand-rolled Japanese green tea leaves was sold for a record 1.96 million yen (nearly ₹12 lakh) at an auction in Japan on Monday. The hand-finished Samidori leaves are from Japan's Shizuoka prefecture, which is famous for quality green tea. Before this, the record for most expensive tea sold in Japan reportedly stood at 1.08 million yen.

73.title: I thought he is possibly at the end of his career, he surprised us all: ABD on Karthik
73.article_body: Talking about RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik, who has scored 197 runs in IPL 2022 at an average of 197 and a strike rate of 209.57, AB de Villiers said, "The last time I saw him before IPL he was commentating in the UK." He added, "I thought he is possibly at the end of his career...but he surprised us all."

74.title: While keeping, he once said 'Do you want chai, samosa?': Suryakumar on Pant's antics
74.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant's antics behind the stumps, Suryakumar Yadav revealed that once he was fielding in place of Cheteshwar Pujara during a Test against England last year. "I was thinking, 'It's my first time on the field wearing whites.'...The match situation was incredibly tight. Pant suddenly said, 'Do you want some chai, samosas? Do you want anything?'" Suryakumar said.

75.title: Shanti Sethi appointed US Vice-Prez Kamala Harris' defence advisor
75.article_body: US Navy veteran Shanti Sethi has joined US Vice-President Kamala Harris' office as her executive secretary and defence advisor. Sethi was reportedly the first Indian-American commander of a major US Navy combat ship and has also been the senior military advisor to Navy Secretary Carlos Del Toro. Harris' Senior Advisor Herbie Ziskend confirmed Sethi's appointment to Politico.

76.title: Soni shares pic of Ranbir & Alia from their wedding; calls them her 'heartbeats'
76.article_body: Soni Razdan shared a picture of Ranbir Kapoor and her daughter, Alia Bhatt, from their wedding. In the picture, Alia is looking overwhelmed and the veteran actress, couldn't take her eyes off her daughter. Soni had captioned the picture, "My heartbeats." The couple tied the knot on April 14 in a traditional ceremony attended by their families and friends.

77.title: Siraj is a rare breed like Umran Malik, needs specialised role: Ajay Jadeja
77.article_body: Ex-India player Ajay Jadeja has said that RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj should be given a specialised role in the ongoing IPL season. "Siraj is a rare breed like Umran Malik. Their potential is up to how you use them...He could be given three overs upfront," he added. So far, Siraj has picked five wickets in six matches in the season.

78.title: Will perform 'aarti' on loudspeakers at Maha temples on May 3: MNS leader
78.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers will perform 'maha aarti' at their local temples across the state, on May 3, on the occasion of Akshaya Tritiya, MNS leader Nitin Sardesai said on Tuesday. "The aarti will be performed using loudspeakers," he added. His comment comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray gave May 3 as ultimatum to remove mosque loudspeakers.

79.title: Drones being used for surveillance in Delhi's Jahangirpuri after violence
79.article_body: After a violence broke out during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Saturday, drones are being used for surveillance in the area. DCP (Central district) Shweta Chauhan said, "Delhi Police [is] also keeping an eye at Jama Masjid and Hauz Qazi area in Central district...with the use of drones." A total of 23 people have been arrested.

80.title: Chahal showed how to change the game within one over vs KKR: Malinga
80.article_body: RR bowling coach Lasith Malinga said Yuzvendra Chahal showed why leg-spinners are considered as match-winners by changing the game in a single over against KKR in IPL 2022. Chahal, who posted 5/40 in the match, took four wickets in 17th over, including his maiden hat-trick in IPL. "He's the most experienced leg-spinner in...country and in this tournament," he added.

81.title: Tried slowing him down but he went harder: Ponting on McCullum's 158*
81.article_body: Talking about ex-KKR opener Brendon McCullum's 158* in the first-ever IPL match in 2008, Ricky Ponting who batted at the number three position for KKR in that match said he tried asking McCullum to bat slower. "McCullum...[went] harder and harder and ended up playing an incredible innings," added Ponting. McCullum's 158* comprised 10 fours and 13 sixes.

82.title: Gurugram civic body plans to complete pre-monsoon work by June 30
82.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram has set June 30 as the deadline to complete all the pre-monsoon work in the city, according to an official order. Additional commissioners and joint commissioners have been appointed as nodal officers to prepare for the season. "We're on track to complete...80-85% of all allotted works for monsoon preparedness this year," an official said.

83.title: Insurance scheme for healthcare workers on COVID-19 duty extended
83.article_body: The insurance scheme for healthcare workers who are engaged in COVID-19-related duties has been extended by 180 days from today, the government said in a press release. The scheme, which is under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Package (PMGKP), has been extended to "provide the safety net to the dependents of health workers". The PMGKP was launched in March 2020.

84.title: MP govt allots ₹1 cr aid for those affected during Khargone violence
84.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government has allotted ₹1 crore for providing relief to the people affected by the communal violence in Khargone. The financial assistance will be provided as per a survey conducted by the district administration, an official said. Stones were hurled during a Ram Navami procession in Khargone, which led to incidents of arson and communal clashes.

85.title: Badshah to make international debut with 'Voodoo' alongside J Balvin
85.article_body: Rapper Badshah on Tuesday took to Instagram to announce his international debut with Colombian singer J Balvin and Puerto Rican producer Tainy. He shared the album cover and wrote, "Namaste India Colombia Latino Gang! We coming this Friday 22nd April 2022! #Voodoo." Balvin commented "INDIA" along with heart emojis. Canadian singer Tesher, known for his song 'Jalebi Baby', wrote, "Yes!!"

86.title: Leopard climbing tree with prey langur falls to death in MP
86.article_body: A leopard reportedly lost her balance and fell to death while climbing a 25-foot tree with her prey, a langur, in the Pench Tiger Reserve in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district. The carcasses of both the animals were found on Monday morning. An official said that the leopard, aged around eight to 10 years, had her ribs and backbone broken.

87.title: Kerala temple displays board banning entry of Muslims during festival; protest erupts
87.article_body: Protests broke out after a board outside the Malliyottu Palottu Kavu temple in Kunhimangalam of Kerala's Kannur said that Muslims were not allowed inside the premises during a festival. The board was put up during the Vishu-related festival in the temple, held between April 14 and 19. Last year, a similar message was displayed outside the temple, as per reports.

88.title: Hindi film industry used to ape the West a lot in the 1990s: Raveena
88.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon said the Hindi film industry used to "ape the West" a lot at one point in the 1990s. "They all wanted to become Hollywood with choppers and westernising. There was a loss of Indian culture in our movies," added Raveena. "I...[would] feel that we are going away from what the masses are identifying with," stated Raveena.

89.title: Sonia meets Prashant Kishor at her residence, 3rd meeting in 1 week
89.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday again met political strategist Prashant Kishor at her residence in Delhi. This is their third meeting in a week amid reports of Kishor joining Congress ahead of Assembly polls later this year and the Lok Sabha elections in 2024. Senior Congress leaders Digvijaya Singh, KC Venugopal, Ambika Soni and Randeep Surjewala attended the meeting.

90.title: Woman burns mother's body after killing her over money in Gr Noida
90.article_body: Greater Noida Police have arrested a woman and her husband for allegedly killing her 56-year-old mother over money. The accused reportedly suffocated her to death, later dragged her body into the kitchen and burned it using petrol. They allegedly left the gas open to pass it off as an accident. The deceased had received ₹15 lakh from her insurance policy.

91.title: Fainting woman falls under moving train in Argentina; pulled out alive
91.article_body: A video showing a woman fainting and falling under a moving train in Argentina's Bueno Aires has surfaced online. The video showed the woman being pulled out alive after stopping the train before an ambulance took her away. "I don't know how I'm still alive. I'm still trying to make sense of it all," the woman said.

92.title: Despite poor start he showed intent: Ajay Jadeja on Chahal's 5-wicket haul
92.article_body: Reacting to RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal's five-wicket haul against KKR which included a hat-trick, ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said Chahal showed intent to pick wickets despite a "poor" start to his spell. "I am trying to convince people that Chahal's cricketing brain is probably three or four times than who we think has the best brain," added Ajay.

93.title: Mamata best suited to lead opposition, Cong busy with infighting: Ripun Bora
93.article_body: Trinamool Congress leader Ripun Bora on Tuesday said Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is best suited to lead an opposition front in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "Congress' leaders in various states are fighting against each other rather than fighting the BJP," Bora added. Notably, Ripun Bora joined the TMC on Sunday after quitting Congress.

94.title: Fish with 'dracula-like fangs' washes up on US beach, pics surface
94.article_body: A fish that looked like a 'dracula' was recently found by a beach walker in California, US. It had two Dracula-like fangs that stuck out of its mouth, alongside a large dorsal fin, an elongated body, and huge eyes. Christopher Martin, the curator of ichthyology at the Museum of Vertebrate Zoology, identified it as a lancetfish, reported the Daily Star.

95.title: Brainless trolls, stop digging out old matters: Himanshi Khurana
95.article_body: Actress Himanshi Khurana on Tuesday shared a statement on social media asking the media to "stop digging out old matters" and letting "bygones be bygones". She added that doing so instigates conversations among "brainless trolls" who then "rip through someone's reputation". This comes after a media portal shared an article on an old controversy between Himanshi and actress Shehnaaz Gill.

96.title: India to use semiconductors of $80 bn to make items worth $300 bn: Govt
96.article_body: Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar has said India will consume semiconductors of about $70-80 billion to manufacture electronics products worth $300 billion by 2026. Of the target of $300 billion in electronic manufacturing, $120 billion is being aimed for export. PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first 'Semicon India 2022 Conference' in Bengaluru.

97.title: MP man uses abusive words, mimics PM Modi, Amit Shah; arrested
97.article_body: A 38-year-old man has been arrested in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur for allegedly mimicking and using abusive words against PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah, police said. This comes after a video of the accused performing a mimicry of PM Modi and Shah's walking style went viral. Following this, right-wing organisations had filed a complaint.

98.title: We've had 2 attempts at getting married, COVID knocked us out of park: Cyrus
98.article_body: Cyrus Sahukar said that he and his wife Vaishali Malahara have been together for eight years and have had two attempts at getting married. "But both times Corona has knocked us out of the park...In February, cases were like 23,000 a day...and we were like how can we possibly get married when there's so much stress...in everyone's life," he added.

99.title: Japan to send masks, hazmat suits to Ukraine amid chemical weapon threat
99.article_body: Japan will send gas masks, hazmat suits and drones to Ukraine amid growing concern about the use of chemical weapons by the Russian military. Japan is sending the anti-chemical-warfare equipment at the request of the Ukrainian government, the country's Defence Minister Nobuo Kishi said. Last month, Japan had provided bulletproof vests, helmets and other non-lethal arms equipment to Ukraine.

100.title: Traffic awareness week being held at Pune's Baner till April 23
100.article_body: A traffic awareness week is being observed at the Radha chowk in Pune's Baner from April 18-23. About 10-15 wardens will be deployed in the area for the initiative. "We plan to post these wardens with traffic police at Saikar chowk, Mamta chowk, Nanaware chowk and Ganpati chowk within Baner and Balewadi to smoothen the traffic clog," an official said.

101.title: Youth must learn spirit of sacrifice, commitment from freedom fighters: VP Naidu
101.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Tuesday said India's youth must learn the spirit of sacrifice and unwavering commitment from our freedom fighters. "They must imbibe...values of...honesty, dedication and selfless service," he said. "Remember that these heroes fought not merely for an abstract geographical entity but to free millions of people from oppressive and unjust British rule," he added.

102.title: DC-PBKS match shifted from Pune to Mumbai after 5 DC members test COVID-19 positive
102.article_body: The BCCI has announced that the DC-PBKS match will be held in Mumbai instead of Pune on April 20 to avoid any further incident due to any undetected case during a long-distance bus journey in a closed environment. This comes after five members of DC's contingent, including all-rounder Mitchell Marsh, tested positive for COVID-19.

103.title: Bail denied to jeweller who bought jewellery stolen from Sonam's home
103.article_body: A Delhi court denied bail to a jeweller who allegedly bought jewellery stolen from Bollywood actor Sonam Kapoor's home in Delhi. While rejecting the plea, the court cited police's objection to the bail because some jewellery was yet to be recovered from him. Stolen jewellery worth over ₹1 crore, including 100 diamonds and six gold chains, was recovered from him.

104.title: India world's largest producer of milk; turnover more than wheat, rice output: PM
104.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said India produces milk worth ₹8.5 lakh crore annually, more than the turnover of wheat and rice. "Today, India is the world's largest producer of milk...Small farmers are the biggest beneficiaries of the dairy sector," the PM added. PM Modi was inaugurating a new dairy complex at Banas Dairy in Gujarat's Banaskantha district.

105.title: B'luru Whitefield area to face power cuts from 10 am-5 pm till Thurs
105.article_body: Bengaluru's Whitefield area will witness power interruptions till Thursday (April 21) due to the cabling work by Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited. According to BESCOM, the areas will face power cuts from 10 am to 5 pm. The affected areas include Channasandra, VSR layout, Koralur, Hosahalli, Prithvi Layout, Whitefield Main road, Upkar Layout, Prashanth Layout and Swami Vivekananda Road.

106.title: Woman returning home from work crushed by BBMP garbage truck, dies
106.article_body: A 40-year-old woman bank employee who was returning home from work on Monday was crushed by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's garbage truck in Bengaluru. The woman was returning from work on a scooter when the garbage truck knocked her down from behind and ran her over. Police have shifted the woman's body to the Victoria Hospital on Mysuru road.

107.title: Rajasthan makes licence mandatory for keeping cows at home in urban areas
107.article_body: A yearly licence and a 100 square yard area will now be mandatory in Rajasthan for keeping cows or buffaloes at homes that fall in urban areas, the state government said. As per the order, penalty of up to ₹10,000 will be imposed on owners if the animals are found straying. However, the rules will not apply to registered gaushalas.

108.title: SP leader booked for threatening to read Quran in front of temples
108.article_body: An FIR has been registered against Samajwadi Party leader Rubina Khanum for allegedly making proactive speeches. Khanum said if no action is taken against groups installing loudspeakers outside mosques to play the Hanuman Chalisa, hundreds of Muslim women would recite Quran in front of temples. Khanum alleged that attempts were being made to target Muslims by banning loudspeakers outside mosques.

109.title: 3 RSS workers held for murder of PFI leader in Palakkad
109.article_body: Kerala Police arrested three RSS workers for the murder of the Popular Front of India (PFI) leader, A Subair, which took place last week in Palakkad, on Tuesday. According to ADGP Vijay Sakhare, the killing of Subair was an act of revenge for an RSS worker's murder in November last year. The accused are identified as Ramesh, Arumughan and Saravanan.

110.title: Bihar govt makes arrangements to quickly ferry kids with AES for treatment
110.article_body: Bihar government has made arrangements of linking an auto-rickshaw with every panchayat to quickly ferry children suffering from acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) to the nearest health facility, officials said on Monday. The arrangements have been made across 12 districts. According to Additional Director (Health), an ambulance has also been attached to every PHC to transport patients.

111.title: Kerala HC refuses to interfere in interfaith marriage
111.article_body: The Kerala High Court on Tuesday refused to interfere in an interfaith marriage between a Muslim man and a Christian woman. It is the woman's will and pleasure, noted the court. The habeas corpus plea demanding the woman to be produced before the court was filed by the woman's father, who alleged that his daughter had been illegally detained.

112.title: I was completely terrified, my heart was racing: Suryakumar on Kohli sledging him
112.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli sledging him in an IPL 2020 match, Suryakumar Yadav said, "His sledging was on another level." "I was chewing gum and looked composed...but on the inside I was completely terrified. My heart was racing," he added. "The voice inside me was screaming [to myself], 'Bro I beg you, please don't say anything'," Suryakumar further stated.

113.title: Ukrainian soldier escapes death as his phone stops bullet fired by Russians
113.article_body: A purported video has surfaced on social media that showed a Ukrainian soldier pulling out a smartphone from his pocket that had a bullet lodged inside it. The soldier had a narrow escape from death as the clip showed the smartphone with a 7.2 mm bullet, that was fired by the Russian troops at him, peeking from its one end.

114.title: IMF appreciates India's help to Sri Lanka amid its worst economic crisis
114.article_body: The chief of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has appreciated India's help to Sri Lanka in the country's fight against its worst economic crisis since independence. Kristalina Georgieva also assured Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman that the financial institution will continue to actively engage with the island nation. India has sent diesel and petrol and offered financial aid to Sri Lanka.

115.title: SBI asks FRL about steps taken to get back stores from Reliance: Report
115.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) has written a letter to Future Retail (FRL) seeking accountability on the takeover of the company's stores by Reliance Industries, BloombergQuint reported. SBI has asked FRL what steps it has taken to safeguard lenders' interests and the efforts taken to get back its assets from Reliance. Reliance took over 947 Future Group stores last month.

116.title: Big B shares fan artwork day after defending another fan's work
116.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan on Monday shared fan-made artwork on Instagram showing him and his son Abhishek Bachchan's faces over cartoon bodies. This comes a day after one of his fan pages criticised artwork done by another fan account saying the creator shouldn't use the actor's face over someone else's body. Amitabh had tweeted, "I like it...Please do...more...Don't pay attention to others."

117.title: Ashwin said 'I was too busy in shoots', then bowled 3 hours in nets: Kaif
117.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has praised RR spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, stating that the 35-year-old is a "genuine wicket-taker, who keeps adding new things". "Ashwin was with me at DC...and I remember...[a] game at the Wankhede [where] he leaked many runs...He felt he was too busy in shoots...[and then] bowled for almost three hours in the nets," recalled Kaif.

118.title: Cong seeks disqualification of its two Rajkot corporators for joining AAP
118.article_body: The Congress has written to the Commissioner of the Rajkot Municipal Corporation requesting him to disqualify two Congress corporators who joined AAP last week. Congress' Rajkot city unit President Pradeep Trivedi alleged that the duo, Vashram Sagathiya and Komal Bharai, were elected as corporators on Congress tickets and therefore, they should be disqualified for joining another party.

119.title: Lay down your weapons immediately: Russia to Ukraine forces
119.article_body: Russia has called on Ukrainian forces to "immediately lay down arms". This comes as Russia launched a new offensive in east Ukraine. Meanwhile, blasts were also heard in Kharkiv in the northeast, Mykolaiv in the south and Zaporizhzhia in the southeast while air raid sirens were also going off in main centres near the front line, officials and media said.

120.title: SBI hikes lending rate by 0.1%, EMIs to go up
120.article_body: India's biggest lender State Bank of India (SBI) has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 10 basis points, or 0.1%, across all loan tenors. With the increase, EMIs will go up for those borrowers who availed loans on MCLR. After the SBI, Kotak Mahindra, and Bank of Baroda, Axis Bank also announced an increase in MCLR.

121.title: 8 injured as 2 TMC groups clash near MP's house in Kolkata; 6 arrested
121.article_body: A clash broke out between two groups of the Trinamool Congress (TMC), who had been trying to take control of the construction business in a locality in Kolkata's Lake Gardens area. Six persons have been arrested in connection with the incident, which left at least eight injured. The incident took place near TMC MP Sougata Roy's residence.

122.title: Scientists name new millipede species Nannaria swiftae after Taylor Swift
122.article_body: Scientists have discovered 17 new species of millipedes living in Appalachian Mountains of the US and named one of them Nannaria swiftae after singer-songwriter Taylor Swift. As per the scientists, the species is named after Taylor "in recognition of her talent as a songwriter and performer and in appreciation of the enjoyment her music has brought [scientist Derek Hennen]".

123.title: No safe corridors agreed for third straight day: Ukraine Dy PM
123.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk on Tuesday said that the country was for the third straight day unable to secure Russia's agreement to establish any humanitarian corridors to evacuate trapped civilians. She added that "difficult negotiations" were taking place to try to arrange humanitarian corridors in the southern region of Kherson and in the Kharkiv region of eastern Ukraine.

124.title: Chef found part of Depp's finger in kitchen: Doctor on actor's fight with Heard
124.article_body: Amid Johnny Depp's defamation lawsuit against ex-wife Amber Heard, the actor's doctor said that a chef found part of Depp's finger in the kitchen, where the two were fighting. Depp told hospital workers he cut himself with a knife, the doctor said. Earlier, Depp said Heard threw a vodka bottle at him, which led to the finger getting cut off.

125.title: Nothing to say: Ex-Twitter CEO on why he didn't do anything about 'dysfunctional' board
125.article_body: After former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey tweeted that their board has "consistently been the dysfunction" of the company, a US journalist argued why he hadn't done anything about it when he ran the firm. Replying to him, Dorsey tweeted, "So much to say…but nothing that can be said." Dorsey's remarks come amid Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter.

126.title: Allu Arjun rejects a large amount to endorse tobacco product: Report
126.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun has declined to become the face of a tobacco company despite being offered "a hefty sum", according to a report. "He rejected it without a second thought as he personally doesn't consume it. [He] doesn't want his fans to watch the ad and start consuming the product, which can lead to addiction," Pinkvilla said quoting a source.

127.title: Tripura govt orders mass execution of pigs amid African Swine Fever outbreak
127.article_body: After Mizoram, Tripura government has now detected cases of African Swine Fever (ASF) at an Animal Resources Development Department-run breeding farm in the state. Over 60 pigs reportedly died due to unknown reasons, raising an alarm about the virus. Following the detection of cases, Tripura has ordered a mass execution of pigs in different phases.

128.title: Don't want to play friend who drives hero to girlfriend’s house: Anant Vidhaat
128.article_body: Actor Anant Vidhaat said that he does not want to play the role of a friend who drives the hero to his girlfriend's house. "I better engage myself doing theatre than doing those roles," he said, adding, "After Sultan, I was mostly getting roles of hero's friend." Anant said that Yash Raj Films gave him a good platform.

129.title: Boney Kapoor shares throwback pic of Arjun Kapoor and Janhvi Kapoor
129.article_body: Boney Kapoor took to Instagram on Tuesday to share an old picture of Arjun Kapoor and Janhvi Kapoor. "Arjun and Janhvi in a playful mood in Burlington (Vermont, USA) during the shooting of our film 'KHUSHI'," he captioned the post. 'Khushi', starring Fardeen Khan and Kareena Kapoor, was released in 2003. The film was produced by Boney.

130.title: Kiara Advani visits the Golden Temple as she shoots for her film RC 15
130.article_body: Kiara Advani, who's currently shooting for her upcoming film 'RC 15', in Amritsar recently shared a post from her visit to the Golden Temple. Taking to Instagram, Kiara shared two pictures of herself standing with her hands folded in front of the shrine. The actress donned a white kurta paired with a yellow dupatta. Alongside the post, she wrote, "Gratitude."

131.title: Waive penalties against Amrapali homebuyers: SC tells banks
131.article_body: The Supreme Court has directed banks to waive penalties against Amrapali homebuyers with outstanding loans and standardise their accounts. "No penalty will be charged from the homebuyers by banks since the default was on part of the builder and not by the buyers," the bench said. In 2019, the court cancelled the registration of Amrapali Group for defrauding homebuyers.

132.title: Sounds high: Musk on Meta spending $26.8 mn on Zuckerberg's security
132.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk in response to a story on Meta spending $26.8 million on CEO Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2021 said, "Sounds high." The figure was reportedly 6% higher than $25.3 million spent in 2020. Private travel and costs associated with security protocols due to the COVID-19 were cited as reasons for such costs in 2021.

133.title: 4 kids injured in Chhattisgarh as Anganwadi building's tiles fall on them
133.article_body: As many as four children were injured at an Anganwadi in Chhattisgarh’s Bhainsbod, after tiles of the building fell over them, Janmejay Mahobe, Balod DM and Collector, said. "We'll look into the cause...Repair work will be done wherever it’s required at the Anganwadis," Mahobe added. A meeting was held to review the condition of the Anganwadis, Mahobe stated.

134.title: Indian economy will be worse than Sri Lanka, Ukraine with riots politics: Raut
134.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that India's economy will be worse than that of Sri Lanka and Ukriane with the "politics of riots". "In big cities of the country...the way situation is tense or such a situation has been created, it's highly unfortunate...Riots are happening in national capital. Delhi is a centre-administered state...it is a union territory," he added

135.title: Japan invents electric chopsticks that make food seem 1.5 times saltier
135.article_body: Japanese researchers have developed electric chopsticks that enhance the taste of salt in food by 1.5 times to reduce sodium levels in the food. The device that comes with a mini-computer worn on a wristband, uses a weak electrical current to transmit sodium ions from food via chopsticks to the mouth, thus creating a sense of saltiness, a researcher said.

136.title: Anuj, Suyash have created positive impact on games: Maxwell
136.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has praised teammates Anuj Rawat and Suyash Prabhudessai for their performances in the ongoing IPL season, stating that the youngsters have "created a positive impact" on the games despite not scoring too many runs. Rawat, who is RCB's opening batter, has scored 125 runs in six matches while Suyash has scored 40 runs in two games.

137.title: PM failed to achieve targets of economic growth in 8 yrs: Subramanian Swamy
137.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP and BJP leader Subramanian Swamy said in eight years in office, PM Narendra Modi has failed to achieve targets of economic growth. "On the contrary, the growth rate has declined annually since 2016," Swamy tweeted. "Modi inexplicably is clueless about China. There is scope to recover but does he know how?" Swamy added.

138.title: IMD predicts cloudy sky with light rain in Delhi on Wednesday and Thursday
138.article_body: Following heatwave conditions on Tuesday, the IMD has predicted a "generally cloudy sky with light rain or drizzle" in Delhi on Wednesday and Thursday. The maximum temperature is likely to decrease from 42°C on Tuesday to 41°C on Wednesday and 39°C on Thursday. The IMD has predicted thunderstorm and lightning over Western Himalayan region and adjoining plains during April 19-21.

139.title: Netherlands head coach Ryan Campbell in induced coma following heart attack
139.article_body: Netherlands head coach and ex-Australia wicketkeeper Ryan Campbell is in induced coma in ICU in UK after suffering a heart attack. The 50-year-old was at a playground with his children when he collapsed. "[We're] in shock to hear of Ryan's medical emergency after suffering a major heart attack over the long weekend," Western Australian Cricket Association CEO Christina Matthews said.

140.title: Go First flight to Delhi stopped at Srinagar airport after bomb call
140.article_body: A Go First flight was halted at the Srinagar airport on Monday after a manager of another airline received a call about a bomb on board, PTI reported. The flight was headed for New Delhi. Inspector General of Police Vijay Kumar said the plane was searched but no explosives were found, adding that the incident was being investigated.

141.title: Had suggestions in Thar, he rejected it; did it his way: Anil on Harsh Varrdhan
141.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor said that while he was shooting for 'Thar' with son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor, he had some suggestions. "But he rejected it. He did it in his own way, and he was right and I was wrong. I really enjoyed working with him," Anil said, adding that Harsh Varrdhan is fearless and he is proud of him.

142.title: Massive fire breaks out at plastic factory in Ludhiana, 2 severely injured
142.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a plastic factory in Ludhiana on Monday evening and two labourers, aged 18 and 40, were severely injured, officials said. The victims had suffered third-degree burns on their face, chest and legs, a hospital's deputy medical superintendent said. "It took around half an hour to bring the flames under control," an official added.

143.title: Wherever there is encroachment, bulldozers should be used: MoS Lekhi
143.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi on Tuesday said that bulldozers should be used to remove encroachments. "Whenever there is an encroachment on public property, it's important to remove it," Lekhi said. Talking about Delhi's Jahangirpuri incident that took place on Hanuman Jayanti, Lekhi said, "It's a conspiracy...to promote enmity to hamper law and order."

144.title: More hepatitis cases in young UK children likely to emerge: WHO
144.article_body: The UK is likely to see a rise in cases of hepatitis in young children in the coming days, the World Health Organisation (WHO) said. Recently, UK reported 74 hepatitis cases. Out of these, some children were transferred to specialist liver units, while six underwent liver transplantation. "The cause of...current hepatitis cases is...unknown and remains under active investigation," WHO added.

145.title: China to send next new space station crew for 6 months in June
145.article_body: China will launch three more astronauts to its newest space station in June for a period of six months. The crew will add two modules to the station, Director of the China Manned Space Engineering Office said. The core module of the Tiangong was launched in April 2021. China plans to complete the station by end of this year.

146.title: Siblings aged 3 & 6 drown in canal in Pune; bodies recovered
146.article_body: The bodies of two siblings, aged three and six, were recovered on Monday night after they drowned in a canal in Pune's Sortapwadi. Police believe that the children were riding a bicycle near the canal and had fallen in after losing control. The children's family had found the bicycle and footwear at the banks of the canal during a search.

147.title: Brain-dead patient's kidneys, lungs and liver donated to save 4 lives in Mumbai
147.article_body: The kidneys, lungs and liver of a critical patient of CritiCare Asia Multi-Specialty Hospital in Mumbai were donated, which saved the lives of four other persons. The patient's organs were transplanted to other hospitals in the city. The family members of the donor, who was declared brain-dead on March 26, were counselled to opt for organ donation.

148.title: KTR inaugurates Skywalk at Mindspace campus in Hyderabad
148.article_body: Telangana Municipal Administration Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday inaugurated a one kilometre long Skywalk at Hyderabad's Mindspace campus. The Skywalk connects the Raidurg Metro Station to strategic locations in and around the Mindspace Madhapur campus and is expected to ease commute for around 30,000 people on a daily basis. It has been designed keeping in mind people with disabilities.

149.title: Attacking police station is serious crime: Bommai on Hubbali stone-pelting incident
149.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that the investigation into the stone-pelting incident at Old Hubbali Police Station, in which 12 policemen were injured, is being carried out thoroughly. "Attacking the police station is a serious crime, action will be initiated against the guilty," he added. According to Hubbali Police commissioner, 88 persons have been arrested in the matter so far.

150.title: Temple shut to prevent groom's entry in MP: Scheduled Caste body
150.article_body: A Scheduled Caste organisation on Monday claimed that "influential people" had closed a temple in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain to prevent the entry of a groom, who's a police constable. However, a police officer said that the Rajput community submitted documents claiming they had built the temple and it was closed due to the priest's family member's death.

151.title: I know we lost but keep your chins up: Shah Rukh Khan after RR defeat KKR
151.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan motivated his IPL team Kolkata Knight Riders as it lost to Rajasthan Royals on Monday. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Well played boys. Stupendous effort by @ShreyasIyer15 @AaronFinch5 @y_umesh congrats to #SunilNarine for the 150th match...I know we lost but if we've to go down this is the only way to do it! Keep your chins up."

152.title: Zilingo board considering replacing Indian-origin CEO amid probe: Report
152.article_body: Singapore's fashion startup Zilingo's board is discussing replacing Indian-origin CEO Ankiti Bose after suspending her earlier this month amid an investigation into the startup's accounting practices, Bloomberg reported. Bose, whose current suspension runs through May 5, has reportedly asked the board to clarify her status. The board has not yet decided who will replace Bose.

153.title: California teen with autism who went missing 3 years ago found alive
153.article_body: A California teenager who went missing nearly three years ago was found alive on April 9, sleeping in a convenience store in Utah's Summit County. Connerjack Oswalt was reported missing in September 2019, when he was 16 years old. Oswalt has now been reunited with his family, "who was losing hope", Summit County Sheriff said in a Facebook post.

154.title: 3 explosions hit school in Afghanistan
154.article_body: Three explosions hit a school in Afghanistan's Kabul on Tuesday, killing several people, according to Afghan security and health officials. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the attack. Many residents in the neighbourhood belong to the Shia Hazara community, an ethnic and religious minority frequently targeted by Sunni militant groups, including Islamic State.

155.title: Will Ram Navami processions be taken out in Pak if not in India: Giriraj
155.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Giriraj Singh asked if Ram Navami processions should be taken out in Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan if not in India. "Had processions of any other faith...been attacked, leaders like Rahul Gandhi and ailing (RJD President) Lalu Prasad...would have hit the streets for their political tourism," he added.

156.title: Afghanistan gets 30 tonnes of food and relief supplies from UAE
156.article_body: Afghanistan received 30 tonnes of food and relief supplies from the UAE amid the humanitarian situation in the country. An aircraft carrying the supplies reached Kabul on Monday. A Taliban spokesperson reportedly said that the supplies will be distributed among the vulnerable people by the government. He further called for unconditional aid, devoid of any political motive.

157.title: Ram Charan gets mobbed by fans in Amritsar, video surfaces
157.article_body: Ram Charan, who was most recently seen in 'RRR', was mobbed by fans in Amritsar, where he's shooting for Shankar's project. In a video, the actor can be seen surrounded by fans, who're chanting his name loudly. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Man of...masses," while another fan wrote, "Can't wait to see similar visuals in London, New York."

158.title: Silly mistakes and not handling pressure well cost us game vs RR: McCullum
158.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum said a couple of silly mistakes and not handling pressure as well as they should have, cost them the game against RR. "We were trying to hold Cummins for the seamers...Mavi's role was to...get through [Yuzvendra Chahal]. Unfortunately, we weren't able to execute [that]," he added. RR's Chahal picked four wickets in KKR's 17th over.

159.title: Instagram rolls out product tagging for public account users in US
159.article_body: Instagram has enabled tagging products in feed posts for all public account users in the US. In a blog post, Instagram explained how the feature would work and said that the idea behind this is to support small businesses and help them get traction. The platform also said they are working on ways for users to tag products in Stories.

160.title: Jack Ma's Ant to be payments platform 2C2P's largest shareholder
160.article_body: Jack Ma-owned Ant Group will become the majority investor in Singapore-based payments platform 2C2P as part of a partnership. The deal will lead to the integration of Ant's Alipay+ payment service with 2C2P's platform used by merchants in Asia, Europe, the Middle East and the Americas. "Through this...partnership...2C2P will be connected to a much larger merchant base," 2C2P CEO said.

161.title: Man, others beat wife, force her to marry alleged lover in Tripura
161.article_body: A woman was allegedly beaten up and forced to marry her "lover" on suspicion of having an extra-marital affair in Tripura's Khowai, police said on Monday. The woman told reporters that her husband along with 15 others had thrashed her until she lost consciousness. The police haven't received a written complaint, but will investigate the matter, a police officer said.

162.title: 5 of family from Rajasthan killed, 2 missing as car falls into canal in Punjab
162.article_body: Five members of a family from Rajasthan were killed as the car they were travelling in was hit by a speeding bus and fell into a canal on Ropar-Chandigarh Highway in Punjab, police said. The search to recover the bodies of two others is on, police added. "After collision...driver lost control...ended up hitting the railing of the bridge," police stated.

163.title: Bride slaps groom twice, storms off stage during jaimala ceremony in UP; video goes viral
163.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a bride slapping the groom twice and walking off the stage during jaimala ceremony in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur district. As per reports, the bride did not like the groom. Local police intervened to bring the situation under control, reports added. The two sides later reached an agreement, reports further stated.

164.title: Pakistan President refuses to administer oath to new cabinet: Reports
164.article_body: The oath-taking ceremony of the new Pakistan federal cabinet has been postponed after President Arif Alvi reportedly refused to administer the oath to them. A notification revealed the names of 30 federal ministers who were to take oath in PM Shehbaz Sharif-led federal cabinet. Imran Khan was removed as Pakistan PM after he lost the no-trust vote against him.

165.title: MP govt land worth ₹300 crore free from encroachment in Bhopal
165.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government's land worth ₹300 crore has been freed from encroachment in Bhopal, an official said on Tuesday. A woman had been allegedly selling shops, that were constructed illegally on this land, and an FIR will be filed against her, an official statement said. The encroached land was in the Chuna Bhatti area, the statement added.

166.title: Mandakini to make a comeback after 26 years, to star in son's music video
166.article_body: 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili' actress Mandakini, who quit the film industry in 1996, is making a comeback with a music video, which will also feature her son Rabbil. The song is about a mother and is titled 'Maa O Maa', director Sajan Agarwal said. "[It's] a very beautiful song and I instantly fell in love with it," Mandakini said.

167.title: Mumbai man gets ₹7.5 lakh prize money letter, ends up losing ₹16 lakh
167.article_body: A 32-year-old Mumbai-based man had received a postal letter, which mentioned a lucky draw from a known online shopping portal with a scratch card in it. On scratching the card, it showed that he had become a lucky winner of ₹7.50 lakh cash prize. The accused induced the victim to pay ₹16 lakh in order to claim the prize.

168.title: Destroyed foreign weapons stored near Ukraine's Lviv city: Russia
168.article_body: Russia carried out airstrikes at a logistics centre of the Ukrainian Army near Lviv city and destroyed large quantities of foreign weapons stored there, Russia's Defence Ministry said. The weapons had entered Ukraine in the last six days from America and European nations, it added. In total, 16 Ukrainian military sites were destroyed by Russia on Monday, it further said.

169.title: Deleted, was creating chaos: MP BJP chief's wife on Hindu-Muslim unity tweet
169.article_body: Madhya Pradesh BJP chief VD Sharma's wife Stuti Mishra said that she has deleted her tweet on 'Hindu-Muslim unity' because it was creating "unnecessary chaos". "It's difficult to share thoughts on a topic of religious fight. Was not [aimed] to hurt anyone's opinion. Let karma do the rest," she said. She had earlier tweeted about a "caring" Muslim shopkeeper.

170.title: PM Modi-led govt’s ‘Swachh Bharat’ campaign changed lives of people: BJP
170.article_body: The Centre has built toilets in over 11.5 crore households under the 'Swachh Bharat' mission, the BJP said on Monday. PM Narendra Modi has worked to fulfil Mahatma Gandhi’s dreams about cleanliness and has effected change in the lives of people, the BJP stated. PM Modi launched the campaign on October 2, 2014.

171.title: UP govt allows maximum 1 month casual leave for employees infected with COVID-19
171.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has issued orders allowing its employees to go on a special causal leave, if infected with COVID-19. As per the order, employees infected with COVID-19 can be given the special leave for a maximum period of one month. The order mentions that this leave can be incurred by infected employees at any time.

172.title: 7 more die of COVID-19 in Shanghai
172.article_body: A day after the first deaths in months were reported, seven more people died in Shanghai due to COVID-19. According to the Chinese government, all of the deceased were elderly aged between 60 and 101 years. "The seven people's condition worsened after being admitted to hospital and they died after the rescue failed," said the government.

173.title: Plan on for 'Dilli Shopping Festival' to create 2 mn jobs: Delhi govt
173.article_body: The Delhi government has begun planning the 'Dilli Shopping Festival', one of the key initiatives announced in its Budget to facilitate 2 million jobs this year, an official statement said. The Arvind Kejriwal-led government, which kept 'rozgar' as its budget theme this year, aims to create 1,20,000 jobs through organising retail and wholesale shopping festivals, as per the budget documents.

174.title: Chhattisgarh CM warns govt doctors against prescribing branded medicines
174.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday warned government doctors against prescribing branded medicines. The warning came while the CM was reviewing the 'Shri Dhanwantari Generic Medical Store Scheme' which ensures availability of generic medicines at affordable rates. According to officials, district collectors and Chief Medical and Health Officers have been asked to ensure strict compliance.

175.title: Class 10 Dalit boy beaten with belt, made to lick feet in UP; 7 arrested
