Patole's remark comes a day after Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray announced that he'll conduct a rally in Aurangabad on May 1. Thackeray had earlier demanded the removal of loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

351.title: Islamic body moves SC against bulldozing houses of riot accused
351.article_body: Islamic body Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind has moved Supreme Court seeking appropriate direction to states against demolishing houses of accused in cases of violence. This comes after Madhya Pradesh government used bulldozers to raze down houses of persons accused of rioting during a Ram Navami procession in Khargone. The petitioner said resorting to such measures is clearly against constitutional ethos.

352.title: Nadal trains for first time in a month since Indian Wells final, shares pic
352.article_body: Twenty-one time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal took to Twitter to share a photo of himself training for the first time since losing in Indian Wells Masters last month. "Today after four weeks without stepping on a tennis court, first light training. What an illusion to step on the earth again!" he wrote. Nadal had injured his rib in semi-final.

353.title: I always found it tough to bowl to Sehwag in IPL: KKR spinner Narine
353.article_body: Ahead of his 150th IPL match, KKR spinner Sunil Narine was asked who he thinks played him the best in IPL, to which he replied Virender Sehwag. "I always found it tough because he was a guy who always kept the game going no matter what situation the team was in, he kept batting the way he did," he added.

354.title: Provide COVID-19 data daily: Centre as Kerala reports data after 5-day gap
354.article_body: Union Health Ministry has written a letter to Kerala Principal Secretary Rajan Khobragade, asking him to ensure updating COVID-19 data daily as the state reported its data after five days since April 13. ''Daily and diligent reporting of data is critical to arrive at a meaningful understanding of the pandemic in districts, state and national level," the ministry added.

355.title: Kangana is Brahmastra in reality show 'Lock Upp': Tusshar Kapoor
355.article_body: Actor Tusshar Kapoor has stated that ALT Balaji has launched a Brahmastra in the form of actress Kangana Ranaut as a host on reality show 'Lock Upp'. "She's the perfect person to host the show. Her frank attitude...courageous nature and the confidence with which she tells people their truth or judges them...is very fair and very real," the actor added.

356.title: KKR to bowl first against RR, RR make three changes to their playing XI
356.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. KKR have made one change to their playing XI, with Shivam Mavi replacing Aman Khan. RR have included Karun Nair, Obed McCoy and Trent Boult in their playing XI.

357.title: Previous govts left Punjab with a debt of ₹3 lakh crore: CM Mann
357.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday blamed state's previous governments for its debt. "Previous governments...left a debt of ₹3 lakh crore on Punjab. But where has this loan been used? We'll investigate and recover [the amount],” AAP's Punjab unit tweeted quoting Mann. Notably, Mann sought financial package of ₹1 lakh crore for state from PM Narendra Modi after assuming charge.

358.title: 8-yr-old boy found dead in Pune's Chikhali, murder probe launched
358.article_body: An 8-year-old boy was found dead with a "fatal injury inflicted with a blunt hard object" at a tin shed in Pune's Chikhali on Sunday, police said. His family had lodged a missing complaint when he didn't return home for a long time following which a search was launched. We've registered a murder case and launched a probe, police added.

359.title: Pressure is at its highest: Zaheer on MI's 6-match losing streak
359.article_body: MI Director of Cricket Operations Zaheer Khan said that the pressure level is "at its highest" for the team as they've lost six consecutive matches in ongoing IPL. "This is a team sport so we have to stick together, have to find ways of coming together and then become a force," he stated. It's MI's worst start in IPL history.

360.title: Don't remember last time I saw damsel in distress on screen: Avantika
360.article_body: Actress Avantika Dassani has stated that she doesn't remember the last time she saw a damsel in distress on the screen. "Everyone keeps asking me this question and I ask them the last time they saw it too," she added. The actress further said that she doesn't want to limit herself to anything, adding that all experiences are welcome.

361.title: Hardik has absolutely thrived in captaincy role for GT in IPL: Kirsten
361.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya for leading GT in IPL 2022, batting coach Gary Kirsten said Hardik is a class and has absolutely thrived in the new role of a captain. "He's a fantastic batter...can play in a lot of different ways...he's played with great maturity," Kirsten added. GT are currently on top of standings, winning five of six matches so far.

362.title: Turkey launches military operation against Kurdish militants in Iraq
362.article_body: Turkey on Monday announced the launch of a new ground and air cross-border military operation against Kurdish militants in northern Iraq. The jets successfully struck shelters, bunkers, caves, tunnels, ammunition depots and headquarters belonging to the militants, the Turkish Defence Minister said. At least 19 Kurdish militants were killed and about four Turkish soldiers were injured, he added.

363.title: Speculative in nature: Mindtree on report of $22 bn merger with L&T Infotech
363.article_body: Mindtree on Monday clarified that news reports of its merger with Larsen & Toubro Infotech are "speculative in nature". Mindtree said, "We would like to state that there is no information available with the company as of today." Bloomberg earlier reported that Larsen & Toubro is considering a merger between the two software firms to create a $22 billion firm.

364.title: What is 'pyramid fraud' that Amway India is accused of running?
364.article_body: The ED accused Amway India of running a 'pyramid fraud' and provisionally attached its assets worth ₹757.77 crore. It alleged Amway of running a pyramid fraud in the guise of direct selling multi-level marketing network and exorbitant pricing of products. "Gullible public is induced to join as members and purchase products at exorbitant prices, losing their hard-earned money," ED said.

365.title: Fati was born to score goals, he reminds me of Samuel Eto'o: Alves
365.article_body: Barcelona player Dani Alves has said that forward Ansu Fati reminds him of former Barcelona forward Samuel Eto'o. "Fati was born to score goals...He is a machine for destroying defences. I think he can also define an era, a special history within Barcelona," Dani added. Fati donned the number 10 jersey after Lionel Messi's departure from the club.

366.title: Lt Gen Manoj Pande appointed Indian Army chief, 1st engineer to hold the post
366.article_body: Lieutenant General Manoj Pande was on Monday appointed as the new chief of the Indian Army. He's the first engineer to hold the post. Pande, who was appointed Vice Chief of the Army Staff in February 2022, will succeed General MM Naravane as Army chief. A decision on the appointment of the Chief of Defence Staff is reportedly still pending.

367.title: Investors lose ₹2.5 lakh crore wealth in a day as Sensex crashes 1,170 points
367.article_body: Nearly ₹2.5 lakh crore was wiped off investors' wealth on Monday as Sensex plunged 1,172 points to settle at 57,166 amid weak global cues. The market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies dropped to ₹269.48 lakh crore from ₹ 272.12 lakh crore in the previous session. Infosys, HDFC, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra, Wipro and TCS were among the top losers on Monday.

368.title: Central Railway organises unique light & sound show at Mumbai's CSMT
368.article_body: Central Railway organised a unique light and sound show at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) heritage building on Sunday to commemorate entering 170th year of Indian Railways. The show was titled 'Navarasangam - ek gatha CSMT ki'. It also commemorated the World Heritage Day, Railway Week and Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav, a celebration of 75 years of India's independence.

369.title: Real Madrid's Benzema is exceptional: Man City manager Pep Guardiola
369.article_body: Ahead of the Champions League semifinal fixture against Real Madrid, Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said that Real Madrid forward Karim Benzema is exceptional. "Benzema is not only a scorer but is a fantastic all-round player. His career is phenomenal," Guardiola added. In the ongoing Champions League season, Benzema has scored 12 goals in nine games played so far.

370.title: Kejriwal to visit Bengaluru on April 21, attend farmers' convention
370.article_body:
Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will visit Bengaluru on April 21 and attend a convention of farmers on the invitation of Karnataka Rajya Raitha Sangha chief and farmer leader Kodihalli Chandrashekhar. 
AAP's Karnataka Convener Prithvi Reddy said the party is the platform for people who fight for farmers' cause. He said AAP wants to get such people elected to Vidhana Soudha.

371.title: Govt registered highest-ever 1.67 lakh companies in FY22, up 8% YoY
371.article_body: Corporate Affairs Ministry registered over 1.67 lakh companies incorporations in FY22, an 8% YoY increase from 1.55 lakh companies incorporations registered in FY21. This is the highest number of company incorporations in a financial year till date. The Ministry said it has taken many initiatives for reducing the number of procedures, time and cost for starting a business in India.

372.title: Goa CM should withdraw comments on 'religious conversion': Cong leader
372.article_body: Congress' Michael Lobo reacted to Goa CM Pramod Sawant's comments on 'religious conversion', stating that Sawant should withdraw the "unwarranted" remarks. "[Sawant's] trying to polarise one section of the society...[he] needs to take everyone along," Lobo added. Sawant had said that Goa government will never allow religious conversions in the state, adding that people should be vigilant about it.

373.title: If philanthropy is love of humanity, my companies are philanthropy: Musk
373.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk said SpaceX, Tesla, Neuralink and The Boring Company, the companies that he has founded, are philanthropy. "If you say philanthropy is love of humanity, they are philanthropy," Musk added. Asked about his views on billionaire philanthropy, he said, "If you care about reality of goodness instead of the perception of it, philanthropy is extremely difficult."

374.title: Noida parents protest school fee hike by polishing shoes
374.article_body: A group of parents in Greater Noida on Sunday polished shoes on the roadside as a symbolic gesture to protest against the hike in fees by private schools. The protest comes despite a UP government order that allowed the schools to hike their fees. The protestors have appealed to the CM to withdraw the order to make education more accessible.

375.title: Pics show final moments of Russian warship after being hit by Ukrainian missiles
375.article_body: Pictures and footage purportedly showing the final moments of the Russian warship Moskva that sank after being hit by two Ukrainian missiles, have been widely shared online. The ship went down in the Black Sea last week after Ukraine said it launched two Neptune missiles. Russia had, however, cited stormy seas as the reason, which the pictures seem to contradict.

376.title: Which cricketers from inaugural IPL match 14 years ago are still playing in IPL?
376.article_body: The first-ever IPL match took place on April 18, 2008 between KKR and RCB. KKR were led by Sourav Ganguly, while RCB were captained by Rahul Dravid. Virat Kohli and Wriddhiman Saha, who are playing in IPL 2022, also featured in the first-ever IPL match. Saha, who made his GT debut on Sunday, represented KKR in the inaugural match.

377.title: NASA shares picture of sunrise on Mars
377.article_body: NASA has shared a picture of the sunrise on Mars captured by its InSight lander. "On April 10, 2022, the 1198th sol (or Martian day) of its mission, our InSight lander took this photo of Martian dawn on the plains of Elysium Planitia," NASA said. InSight is NASA's first mission to study the interior of Mars in depth.

378.title: I'm happy South films are breaking into new territories: Anil Kapoor
378.article_body: Anil Kapoor said that the South has always been making "exceptional" films and added he is "happy" that South films are breaking into new territories. "I started my career with films down south and it gives me immense pleasure to see them doing so good," he stated. This comes after 'RRR', and 'Pushpa: The Rise' were commercial successes across India.

379.title: Ukraine has completed questionnaire for EU membership: Official
379.article_body: Ukraine has completed a questionnaire that will form the starting point for the European Union (EU) to consider the country's membership in the bloc, Ihor Zhovkva, Deputy Head of President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's Office, said. Ukraine expects to acquire candidate country status for accession to the EU in June, Zhovkva added. Ukraine signed an application to join the EU in February.

380.title: Shocking and saddening: PM Modi on the demise of 18-year-old TT player Vishwa
380.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday tweeted, "The demise of TT champion Vishwa Deenadayalan is shocking and saddening." The 18-year-old table tennis player from Tamil Nadu died in a road accident on Sunday while travelling from Guwahati to Shillong for the 83rd Senior National and Inter-State Table Tennis Championship. PM Modi said Vishwa had distinguished himself in several competitions.

381.title: Who is Jammu fruit seller's son Umran Malik, the fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022?
381.article_body: SRH pacer Umran Malik, the fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022, was born on November 22, 1999 in Jammu and Kashmir. His father is a fruit seller. Umran was SRH's net bowler in IPL 2021 and he replaced T Natarajan in main squad after the latter was ruled out due to COVID-19. He was retained by SRH for ₹4 crore.

382.title: Never ever get a tattoo: Samantha to fan despite having 3 tattoos
382.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu held an 'ask me anything' session on Instagram Stories during which a fan asked for tattoo suggestions. The actress responded, "You know the one thing I'd tell my younger self is never ever get a tattoo. Never. Never ever. Ever, get a tattoo."  Samantha reportedly has three tattoos connected to her ex-husband Naga Chaitanya.

383.title: Training aircraft of pvt flying school topples on runway, 1 injured
383.article_body: A training aircraft of a private flying school toppled during landing at the Jakkur Aerodrome in Bengaluru on Sunday evening. An international skydiving champion, who was on the aircraft, received minor injuries as she was rescued by the pilot. The pilot reportedly spotted dogs and birds on the runway after landing and acted immediately.

384.title: 4 civilians shot dead in Ukraine's Luhansk region: Governor
384.article_body: Four civilians were reportedly shot dead during a Russian attack in Ukraine's eastern Luhansk region. The victims were trying to flee the Kreminna city by car when the incident occurred, said regional Governor Serhiy Gaidai in a Telegram post, according to a report. Meanwhile, multiple blasts were reported in Ukraine's Kyiv, Lviv and Dnipro regions.

385.title: Body of unidentified man found at Vasai beach in Palghar
385.article_body: The body of an unidentified man was found in a highly decomposed state at Vasai's Bhuigaon beach in Maharashtra's Palghar district. The body was spotted by fishermen and local people on Sunday evening, police said, adding that prima facie, the body was swept ashore by sea waves. A case of accidental death has been registered and an investigation is underway.

386.title: Noida is UP's crown just as Kashmir is India's crown: UP minister
386.article_body: UP Cabinet Minister Nand Gopal Gupta on Sunday said, "The way Kashmir...is a crown for India similarly, Noida is Uttar Pradesh's crown." Gupta made the comment during a visit to Noida on the occasion of the city's 47th foundation day. He inaugurated and laid foundation stones to projects worth ₹107 crore during the visit.

387.title: 20 injured after bus overturns in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar
387.article_body: A bus returning from a marriage party overturned on the Khuria Rahatgarh road in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district on Monday. According to the police, at least 20 passengers got injured after the bus skidded off the road. The bus, which was returning to Kesli, overturned after its driver, who later fled the spot, dozed off while driving, police said.

388.title: Stones pelted at ladies coach in Bandra, railway police file case
388.article_body: The railway police have suo motu registered a case following a tip-off about an alleged stone-pelting incident. According to police, a female commuter informed on a helpline that an unknown person pelted stones on a ladies' coach of a local train when it halted at Bandra station's platform seven. The train had, however, left when police reached the platform.

389.title: Ukrainian pilots launch 'buy me a jet' website to crowdfund war planes
389.article_body: Ukrainian pilots have launched a website 'buymeafighterjet.com' seeking crowdfunding to purchase new fighter jets amid the country's war with Russia. A video uploaded on the website showed destroyed Ukrainian military equipment and infrastructure while a pilot looks into the camera and said, "Buy me a fighter jet". As per the website, the average cost of a jet is $25 million.

390.title: SRK & Shehnaaz hug each other at Baba Siddique's Iftar party, video surfaces
390.article_body: Indian politician Baba Siddique hosted an annual Iftaar party at Hotel Taj Lands End in Mumbai's Bandra which was attended by several celebrities. Recently a video has surfaced online where Shehnaaz was all smiles as she hugged actor Shah Rukh Khan. For the party, Shehnaaz opted to wear a light grey Patiala suit along with matching jhumkas.

391.title: Tusshar congratulates Ranbir-Alia, says 'It was private wedding which I respect'
391.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor on Monday congratulated the newlywed Bollywood couple Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. "Very nice pictures, very natural. It was a private wedding which [I] respect," he said while talking to the media. "My best wishes from the family because Chintu Ji (Rishi Kapoor) was my father's (Jeetendra) close friend. So hearty wishes to them from...entire family," Tusshar added.

392.title: My 94*(51) vs CSK reminds me of my 2013 century for KXIP: Miller
392.article_body: After playing a match-winning knock of 94 runs against CSK, the Gujarat Titans batter David Miller said that this knock reminded him of his century which he scored for the Kings XI Punjab in 2013. "It does take me back to memory lane (referring to the 2013 knock)...with the rate quite high, I wanted to express myself (yesterday)," Miller said.

393.title: It was a minor incident: Police on fresh stone-pelting in Jahangirpuri
393.article_body: The fresh stone-pelting in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, where a communal violence broke out on Saturday, was a minor and one-off incident, police said on Monday. "Legal action is being taken. One person has been detained," it added. Police had earlier said that family members of an accused pelted two stones at a team when they went to question them.

394.title: Cyrus Sahukar's wife Vaishali Malahara shares wedding pics
394.article_body: Actor Cyrus Sahukar's wife Vaishali Malahara on Monday shared pictures from their wedding day on Instagram. She wrote, "With These 7 steps May you become my friend and May I deserve your friendship. May my friendship make me one with you and May your friendship make you one with me." The couple got married on April 15 in Alibaug.

395.title: People have wrong impression of Harsh Varrdhan that he's introvert: Anil on son
395.article_body: Speaking about his son, actor-producer Harsh Varrdhan, Anil Kapoor said people have this wrong impression of him that he's introverted and serious. "I was happy that media, critics and everybody praised his work and loved what he did [in AKvsAK]," he added. Speaking about his second collaboration with Harsh Varrdhan, Anil hilariously revealed Harsh Varrdhan rejected some of his suggestions.

396.title: Invited Macron to see evidence of ‘genocide’ in Ukraine: Zelenskyy
396.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that he has invited his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron to visit Ukraine and see the evidence of 'genocide'. "I want him (Macron) to understand that this is not war, but...[a] genocide," Zelenskyy added. His comments come days after Macron refused to call the ongoing Russian military offensive in Ukraine a 'genocide' in an interview.

397.title: Watching Umran bowl at 150 clicks an hour is super exciting: Steyn
397.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad pace bowling coach Dale Steyn has said that watching the 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik "bowl at 150 clicks an hour consistently is super exciting". "Very often we try and create guys to make them more aware like changing your pace...But I think Umran is out and out raw. It's great to just let him loose," Steyn said.

398.title: 2 youths die after drowning in waterfall on Nagaon-Karbi Anglong border
398.article_body: Two youths lost their lives after  they drowned in a waterfall on Assam's Nagaon-Karbi Anglong district border. Police said that the deceased have been identified as Sajadul Islam and Raj Bora. Reports said that four people including the deceased had visited the waterfall and had gone missing. Police added that they reached the spot after getting information from the locals.

399.title: 3 masked men try to rob Ludhiana finance company’s office, manage to escape
399.article_body: Three masked men attempted to rob the office of a finance company in Ludhiana’s Raikot on Saturday. The manager of the firm said the robbers asked him to hand over almirah's keys to them. On resisting, the accused opened fire in the air. However, after the manager raised the alarm, the accused persons managed to escape.

400.title: Best hospitality in the world: Pietersen in Hindi before joining IPL commentary team
400.article_body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen on Monday praised India in a tweet in Hindi ahead of joining the IPL commentary team and said, "Very excited to be back in India." He added, "Experiencing the best hospitality in the world is something I will never take lightly! See you in a few hours, India!"

401.title: They once had to eat samosas for breakfast: Rai on issues faced by India Women in 2017 WC
401.article_body: Talking about issues faced by India Women during 2017 World Cup, Vinod Rai revealed ahead of India's semi-final match against Australia, the players couldn't get the food they were supposed to. "They had to eat samosas for breakfast that morning!" Rai added that Harmanpreet Kaur, who scored 171* in that match, told him that she was cramping during her knock.

402.title: Bitcoin falls to lowest in a month, global crypto market's value falls to $1.9 trillion
402.article_body: The world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell as much as 4.2% to $38,580 and the second-largest cryptocurrency, Ether, dropped 4.7% to as low as $2,902 on Monday. The global crypto market’s value dropped about 4% in the past 24 hours to $1.9 trillion, according to the pricing from CoinGecko. Bitcoin has been struggling along with risk assets in recent months.

403.title: Keerthy congratulates Madhavan's son on bagging gold at Danish Open
403.article_body: Actress Keerthy Suresh took to Twitter to congratulate Madhavan's 16-year-old son Vedaant on winning a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022. "Kudos to the champion Vedaant Madhavan. Your achievement is an inspiration to all! Congratulations to the proud father," she wrote. Vedaant won the medal in the 800m swimming event.

404.title: Sri Lanka Cricket asked to confirm on hosting Asia Cup by July 27: Report
404.article_body: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) board has been reportedly asked by the Asian Cricket Council (ACC) to decide on hosting the Asia Cup tournament by July 27. The tournament is scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka but the ongoing economic and political crisis in the country might take away the hosting rights from the SLC, a source said.

405.title: Party will decide on plan to expand, rejig Cabinet: K'taka CM
405.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said BJP President JP Nadda will hold a meeting regarding the state and thereafter decide on Karnataka Cabinet's expansion or reshuffle. This comes as BJP gears up for Karnataka Assembly polls which are scheduled to be held next year. There are currently 29 ministers in the state Cabinet against the sanctioned strength of 34.

406.title: Was never influenced by Salman Khan: 'Tere Naam' co-star Bhumika
406.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla, speaking about her 'Tere Naam' co-star Salman Khan, has said that she was never influenced by him "in any such manner". Bhumika added, "Salman has changed a lot, I see so much difference." "From what I hear...[Salman has] seen a kind of good growth in him as a person and even as an artist," she further stated.

407.title: I smeared henna all over my face at Alia-Ranbir's mehendi: Karan
407.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has revealed that he mistakenly smeared henna all over his face at Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's mehendi ceremony. He said that he had decided to get mehendi on his hands but wasn't used to it and tried wiping sweat from his face but smeared it with henna. "Alia's makeup artist...applied lotion on my face." Karan added.

408.title: Won’t accept N Korea’s escalating tests as normal: US envoy
408.article_body: A US official has called for a joint deterrent along with South Korea against North Korea's escalating weapons tests. "It is extremely important for the United Nations Security Council to send a clear signal to the DPRK (Democratic People's Republic of Korea) that we will not accept its escalatory tests as normal," said Sung Kim, US envoy on North Korea.

409.title: Mariupol doesn't exist anymore: Ukraine's Foreign Minister after Russian siege
409.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has said the port city of Mariupol "doesn't exist anymore". "The situation in Mariupol is both dire militarily and heartbreaking. The city doesn't exist anymore," Kuleba told CBS News. "It seems from the way the Russian army behaves in Mariupol, they decided to raze the city to the ground at any cost,"  he added.
